The access to this dataset can be **slow** and is intended for **expert** users to access the **complete** set of data produced by UERRA. **1. Efficient download of data**
Data are stored on tapes in MARS, the ECMWF Meteorological Archival and Retrieval System. Accessing data from tapes is generally slower than accessing data directly from disk.
To retrieve MARS data efficiently you should retrieve all the data you need from one tape, then from the next tape, and so on. In most cases, this means retrieving all the data you need for one month, then for the next month, and so on.
To find out what data is available on each tape, browse the MARS [UERRA Catalogue][uerra-catalogue] and make your way until the bottom of the tree archive (where parameters are listed).
Once you will have reached that level of the archive, what you see is what you can find on one single tape. **2. Expert users**
The access to the complete set of UERRA data is provided through the Climate Data Store Application Program Interface (CDS API).
This requires the installation of the CDS API application in the users' computer. More information on how to install it is [here][cds-api-how-to].
Requests for these data using the CDS API have to use the MARS request syntax.
See the [MARS keywords][mars-keyword] documentation to learn how MARS keywords can be used to retrieve and manipulate MARS data.
Data availability is not checked beforehand. This means that the requests may fail if they look for nonexistent data.
Examples of requests using the CDS API are given in the Documentation. **3. Complete set**
The four other [UERRA entries][uerra-entries] in the CDS Catalogue provide a clickable form to choose and download a subset of UERRA data.
They are a very convenient way for new users to discover the UERRA dataset.
However, by using the CDS API, expert users can access the whole UERRA dataset. This includes UERRA forecast data and UERRA data on model levels. **4. Terms of use**
Users need to accept the Terms of use of this dataset before being able to download the data. Once logged in, a new widget will appear which allow the user to view the terms and conditions of use and accept them.
